content: another stanza for INTERNALCLIENTPARMS as shown. The INACTIVE statement is optional. The secondary PORT statement is also optional. These changes cause transport security services to start when TCP/IP is started. The important lines in this file are shown before the file is edited in Example 6-25, and after the file is edited in Example 6-26. Example 6-25 TCPIP profile before SSL server modifications ; ----------------------------------------------------------- LARGEENVELOPEPOOLSIZE 50 16384 ; ----------------------------------------------------------- ... ; ----------------------------------------------------------- PORT 20 TCP FTPSERVE NOAUTOLOG ; FTP Server 21 TCP FTPSERVE ; FTP Server 23 TCP INTCLIEN ; TELNET Server ... 2049 UDP VMNFS ; NFS Server 2049 TCP VMNFS NOAUTOLOG ; NFS Server Chapter 6. Configuring z/VM 223 Example 6-26 TCPIP profile with SSL Server modifications shown ; ----------------------------------------------------------- LARGEENVELOPEPOOLSIZE 50 16384 SSLSERVERID
